alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 715 PM MDT... At 630 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crystal Lake Reservoir, or 16 miles west of Cheyenne, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Federal around 645 PM MDT. Horse Creek around 705 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 23 and 34. Interstate 80 in Wyoming near mile marker 340, and between mile markers 342 and 350. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
